We're Hiring


Student Involvement is hiring for Fall 2023! Open positions include Student Involvement Programming Assistants (PEAPs) and Summer Orientation Leaders. Apply on Handshake, by email, or by Google Form (PEAP version | Summer Orientation version). Apply by April 1, 2023!



  






You are hereAbout Student Involvement ›  
Recognized Student Organizations






Recognized Student Organizations (RSOs) are made up of over 120 student led clubs and organizations with themes ranging from academics, athletics, culture, professional, performing arts, special interest, political, spiritual, social justice, wellness, and many others.  Getting involved with an RSO is one of the quickest ways to connect with other Seawolves, develop friendships, explore your passions, and gain leadership experience. All are open to currently enrolled Sonoma State students. 
You can find and explore a directory of all active Recognized Student Organizations at Sonoma State by clicking on “Organizations” from the homepage of GetInvolved@SSU.
If you don’t see an RSO that fits your specific interests or needs, starting a new club or organization is easy! Please review the following basic requirements for starting the recognition process below: 

Recruit at least 4 other SSU students (5 total including yourself) that are interested in joining your organization.


Once you have 5 total members, decide who would like to serve as the President and who would like to serve as the Treasurer. 


Recruit a faculty or staff member that is interested in serving as your Advisor.


Schedule a meeting with the appropriate Student Involvement Advisor to discuss the next steps of the Recognition Process. 

The relationships and experience you gain through your involvement in a Recognized Student Org will have immeasurable impact on your experience at SSU and beyond. Make sure to check out GetInvolved@SSU and see all the possibilities. If you have questions about student organizations at Sonoma State, please contact Student Involvement at studentinvolvement@sonoma.edu.

How to Report 







































 
 


Getting involved in Disney Club and Intervarsity was one of the best decisions I could have made in college. I've made countless connections and friendships, all while growing as a person and having fun! It's a great way to feel connected to the greater school community.





Kat Ness, Disney Club & Intervarsity



 
   





 


FAASSU has pushed me to grow both as a person and as a leader. I have been able to explore and appreciate my Filipino heritage and meet so many people with similar experiences and interests along the way. This club has been a huge source of comfort and feels like my home away from home. I am nothing but grateful for all the friends and memories I've made thus far.





Hannah Alferez, Filipino American Association President



 
   
 


Being a part of the Disney Club has been one of the highlights of my time at SSU. Each meeting is a different theme which has been super exciting. I have met some amazing people and been able to bond over our love of all things Disney! 





Lauren Banchieri, Disney Club President 



 
   





 


Being part of the SSU Geology club has deepened my connection with being a student of the SSU Geology department. I was able to meet with students and professors of the department who helped me provide insight into the Geology major. Events hosted by the Geology club presented opportunities that are available as a geologist.





Michael Jones, SSU Geology Club President



 
   





 


Starting the Anime Club was a pretty cool experience that was a major part of my freshman year. I was able to meet a whole bunch of new people and we had a lot of fun over the pandemic. 





JT DePriest, Anime Club President
